intro: Gymnacranthera forbesii var. crassinervis, commonly known as the broad-veined gymnacranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, elliptical leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, dark blue berries. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
